body_html:
Further observations:

  • The leak occurs with a simple script, but not when the gpu is disabled.
woodward@dev-box:~$ cat leak.py
import tensorflow as tf

hello = tf.constant('hello')
with tf.Session() as sess:
  print sess.run(hello)
woodward@dev-box:~$ free -g
             total       used       free     shared    buffers     cached
Mem:           125          0        125          0          0          0
-/+ buffers/cache:          0        125
Swap:          127          0        127
woodward@dev-box:~$ for i in `seq 1 100`; do python leak.py &> /dev/null; done
woodward@dev-box:~$ free -g
             total       used       free     shared    buffers     cached
Mem:           125          7        118          0          0          0
-/+ buffers/cache:          7        118
Swap:          127          0        127
woodward@dev-box:~$ export CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=-1
woodward@dev-box:~$ for i in `seq 1 100`; do python leak.py &> /dev/null; done
woodward@dev-box:~$ free -g
             total       used       free     shared    buffers     cached
Mem:           125          7        118          0          0          0
-/+ buffers/cache:          7        118
Swap:          127          0        127
woodward@dev-box:~$ export CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0
woodward@dev-box:~$ for i in `seq 1 100`; do python leak.py &> /dev/null; done
woodward@dev-box:~$ free -g
             total       used       free     shared    buffers     cached
Mem:           125         14        111          0          0          0
-/+ buffers/cache:         14        111
Swap:          127          0        127
woodward@dev-box:~$ ps -Ao user,pid,%mem,vsz,rss,command --sort -rss | head -n 5
USER       PID %MEM    VSZ   RSS COMMAND
root      1258  0.0 105648  6420 sshd: woodward [priv]
root     18088  0.0 104436  6120 sshd: root [priv]   
woodward  1331  0.0  22756  5684 /bin/bash
woodward  1329  0.0  22748  5608 /bin/bash
